monitoringFrequency.monthly: Required - track all payments and progress

monthlyReview.recommendedTime: Sunday morning with coffee - make it pleasant

checklist.action: Log into each account or check statements, record current balance in tracking spreadsheet
checklist.note: Automated tracking apps can streamline this - YNAB, Mint, etc.

checklist.task: Verify all minimum payments posted correctly
checklist.action: Review bank account/credit card statements to confirm all minimums cleared on time
checklist.lookFor: Missed payments, late fees, returned payment fees - address immediately

checklist.task: Confirm extra payment applied to target debt
checklist.action: Verify $500 (or current amount) was applied to correct debt in payoff sequence
checklist.note: If promotional phase (months 1-6): Ensure payments going to promotional deadlines in order

checklist.action: Review remaining promotional balances and time until deadline. Adjust allocation if needed.

checklist.task: Calculate total debt reduction this month
checklist.action: Compare total debt this month vs. last month. Calculate reduction (should be ~$10,534 in month 1)
Recalculate days/months until unsecured debt freedom based on current progress
checklist.note: Should decrease by 30-31 days each month if on track

checklist.action: Check what milestones are approaching (next account payoff, 6-month mark, 1-year anniversary, etc.)
If using visual debt chart, update progress. If accounts closed this month, mark them off!
checklist.psychologicalBenefit: Physical act of crossing off debt is powerful

checklist.action: Total available attack payment = $500 base + all freed minimum payments from closed accounts
checklist.note: Watching this grow is motivating - Month 1: $500 → Month 6: $822 → Month 12: $1,150

checklist.task: Check for windfalls or unexpected expenses
checklist.action: Review the past month - any bonuses, tax refunds, side income? Any emergency expenses?
checklist.note: Windfalls: Apply per windfall formula. Emergencies: Adjust plan if needed.

checklist.action: Confirm $1,751 MMI payment deducted correctly for the 8 consolidated debts
checklist.note: MMI program requires consistent payments - cannot miss

checklist.action: Check emergency fund balance - goal is $1,000 starter fund, then $24,500 full fund
checklist.action_if_below: If emergency fund <$1,000, allocate some extra payment to building it until reached

redFlags.action: Pay IMMEDIATELY to minimize late fee. Call creditor if already late - request fee waiver. Set up autopay if possible.
redFlags.consequence: Late fees, interest rate increases, credit score damage

redFlags.flag: Total debt increased instead of decreased
redFlags.action: Investigate: New debt added? Interest accrual higher than payments? Emergency expense on credit card? Address root cause.

redFlags.flag: Promotional deadline approaching with insufficient balance
redFlags.action: Reallocate payments immediately. Temporarily reduce extra payment to other debts if needed to defend deadline.
redFlags.consequence: Deferred interest charges (up to $1,766 on Container Store alone)

redFlags.flag: Unable to make extra $500 payment this month
redFlags.action: Assess reason. If temporary cash crunch, make minimums only this month. If systemic issue, reassess budget.
redFlags.consequence: Timeline extends but strategy still valid - progress over perfection

celebrationTriggers: Account closed this month → Update visual tracker, add $10 to Freedom Fund jar
Promotional deadline defended → Calculate deferred interest saved, celebrate that amount
Snowball grew this month → Note the increase, visualize the acceleration
On-time payment streak milestone (every 6 months) → Small reward

Any unexpected setbacks or accelerations?

Can we increase extra payment from $500 to $600 or more?

protocol.action: Assess whether current strategy (hybrid avalanche with promos first) is working optimally.

protocol.action: Review last quarter's expense reduction initiatives. What worked? What didn't?

protocol.action: Review upcoming milestones in next quarter and plan celebrations.

year6.keyAchievement: Final stretch - only low-rate debts remaining

strategyChangeTriggers.trigger: Promotional deadline missed - deferred interest charged
strategyChangeTriggers.assessment: How much deferred interest was charged? What went wrong?
strategyChangeTriggers.action: Set up automated calendar alerts for all remaining deadlines. Consider autopay for promotional balances. Learn from mistake and prevent recurrence.
strategyChangeTriggers.strategyChange: NO - stay the course, just improve execution

strategyChangeTriggers.assessment: Can we dramatically accelerate payoff timeline?
strategyChangeTriggers.action: Recalculate with increased extra payment (e.g., $500 → $1,000+). Update debt-free date projection. Consider lump-sum payments to high-rate debts.

strategyChangeTriggers.assessment: Can we maintain minimums + MMI commitment + mortgages?
strategyChangeTriggers.action: Reduce extra payment to preserve cash flow. Use emergency fund if needed. Prioritize: Mortgages > MMI > Essential minimums > Extra payments.
strategyChangeTriggers.strategyChange: DECELERATION - same strategy, slower execution, or switch to minimums-only temporarily

strategyChangeTriggers.trigger: Major emergency requires adding new debt
strategyChangeTriggers.assessment: How much new debt? What APR? How does it fit in payoff sequence?
strategyChangeTriggers.action: Integrate new debt into strategy. Reassess timeline. If high APR, may become new priority in avalanche sequence. If low APR, may go to end of list.
strategyChangeTriggers.strategyChange: INTEGRATION - adjust payoff order and timeline

strategyChangeTriggers.trigger: SPS mortgage refinancing opportunity (rate drop to <7%)
strategyChangeTriggers.assessment: What are closing costs? What's monthly savings? Payback period?
strategyChangeTriggers.action: Get quotes from 3-5 lenders. Calculate all costs and savings. If payback period <24 months, refinance. Apply monthly savings to unsecured debt.
strategyChangeTriggers.strategyChange: OPTIMIZATION - reduce mortgage cost, accelerate unsecured payoff

strategyChangeTriggers.assessment: What's net proceeds after SPS payoff? What's best use of proceeds?
strategyChangeTriggers.action: Calculate: Sale price - SPS balance - closing costs = net proceeds. Apply 90% to highest-rate unsecured debts (SoFi, Navy Federal CCs). Recalculate timeline - likely 3-4 years acceleration.
strategyChangeTriggers.strategyChange: ACCELERATION - eliminate SPS mortgage + attack unsecured debt with proceeds

strategyChangeTriggers.trigger: Balance transfer or consolidation opportunity (0% or <8% APR)
strategyChangeTriggers.assessment: What debts can we consolidate? What's total savings vs. fees?
strategyChangeTriggers.action: Calculate: Interest saved - consolidation fees = net benefit. If net benefit >$1,000, pursue. Common targets: SoFi (17.89%), Navy Federal CCs (12-16.7%).
strategyChangeTriggers.strategyChange: OPTIMIZATION - reduce interest rates, accelerate payoff

strategyChangeTriggers.assessment: Is debt payoff journey causing relationship strain, health issues, or severe quality of life reduction?
strategyChangeTriggers.action: Reduce extra payment amount. Extend timeline. Focus on minimum payments + smaller extra payment ($200-300 instead of $500). Sustainability is more important than speed.
strategyChangeTriggers.strategyChange: DECELERATION - prioritize long-term sustainability over short-term acceleration

strategyChangeTriggers.assessment: What's best use: Emergency fund, debt payoff, or combination?
strategyChangeTriggers.action: Apply windfall formula: Emergency fund gap → 10% reward → 90% to current target debt. If eliminates major debt (e.g., SoFi), massive acceleration.

strategyChangeTriggers.assessment: Do new refinancing or consolidation options become available?
strategyChangeTriggers.action: Shop for personal loan to consolidate high-rate debts. Check balance transfer offers. Explore SPS mortgage refinancing. Better credit = better options.
strategyChangeTriggers.strategyChange: OPTIMIZATION - leverage improved credit for better rates

strategyChangeTriggers.trigger: Reaching Phase 2 (avalanche attack after promotional phase)
strategyChangeTriggers.assessment: Are we ready to pivot from promotional defense to pure avalanche?
strategyChangeTriggers.action: Month 7 (June 2026): Confirm all 6 promos paid off and $1,972 saved. Pivot to highest APR attack (PayPal standard balances, then Amex cards). Snowball should be ~$822/month.
strategyChangeTriggers.strategyChange: PHASE TRANSITION - planned evolution of strategy

strategyChangeTriggers.assessment: What do we do with freed $4,898.57/month?
strategyChangeTriggers.action: Annual review in 2033 will decide: (1) Attack SPS mortgage aggressively, (2) Attack LoanCare mortgage, (3) Invest in retirement, (4) Balanced approach. Likely best: SPS mortgage elimination (2033-2036), then reassess.
strategyChangeTriggers.strategyChange: PHASE TRANSITION - pivot to mortgage payoff or wealth building
